meanings.definition: The amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something.
meanings.sent1: The price of the toy was too high for me to buy.
meanings.sent2: She asked for the price of the book before deciding to purchase it.
meanings.sent3: The price of admission to the zoo was so high that I had to borrow money from my friend.
meanings.sent4: The price of success is hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent5: The price tag on the dress showed it was on sale.

meanings.definition: To set the price of something.
meanings.sent1: He will price the old furniture before putting it up for sale.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to price their new product competitively in the market.
meanings.sent3: I will price the cookies at a reasonable rate to attract more customers.
meanings.sent4: She priced her services higher after gaining more experience in the field.
meanings.sent5: The artist priced his paintings based on their size and complexity.

meanings.definition: To find out the price of something.
meanings.sent1: I need to price the laptop to see if it fits within my budget.
meanings.sent2: She priced the concert tickets to see if they were affordable for her.
meanings.sent3: I will price the shoes to check if they are worth the cost.
meanings.sent4: He priced the car to determine its resale value.
meanings.sent5: The customer priced the necklace before deciding to purchase it.
